alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 6:04PM PST until January 06 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 1 PM PST FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. Local sets up to 15 feet will be possible during the highest surf. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday to 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The high tides will be near 6.0 feet between 8 AM to 830 AM PST.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
